channel.title: Conference on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Conference on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Vitamin D Conference - 6th Minimum, Maximum, Optimum
item.description:
• Introductory lecture: Vitamin D – for health of the individual, does it also influence the public health?
    • Session I. Nutritional rickets
      • Nutritional rickets: an overview
      • Ukrainian recommendations on preventing and treating nutritional rickets
      • Rickets types and treatment with vitamin D and analogues
    • Session II. Updated guidelines for Vitamin D in Poland, 2023
      • General overview and introduction to the main recommendations
      • Guidelines for newborns, premature neonates, infants and pregnant women
      • Guidelines for children and adolescents
      • Guidelines for adult population
      • Guidelines for seniors and oldest olds
    • Special lecture: Why is Germany so conservative in vitamin D recommendations?
    • Session III. Central European and Eastern European Guidelines
      • Fragility, fractures and vitamin D
      • Pleiotropic actions of vitamin D
      • Central and Eastern European Guidelines AD 2022
      • Ukrainian Guidelines in 2023
      • Special lecture: Sources of vitamin D and calcifediol – natural and artificial/man-made: a celebration of the last day of skin synthesis
      • Special lecture: Epigenetic and genomic view on vitamin D: a “celebration” of the first day of autumn / first day of the lack of skin synthesis
    • Session IV. Pleiotropic action of vitamin D (Part 1)
      • Periodontal disease as the canary in the coal mine
      • Vitamin D deficiency and cardiovascular disease: current knowledge
      • 25 Hydroxyvitamin D serum concentration and COVID-19 severity and outcomes – a Romanian experience
      • Vitamin D in endocrine diseases
      • Effect of vitamin D deficiency on trabecular and cortical bone compartments – the 3D DXA modelling approach
      • Relationship of vitamin D deficiency with insulin resistance
      • Risk groups for low vitamin D: changing the paradigm in clinical practice
      • Special Lecture: Calcifediol: a review of its pharmacological characteristics and clinical use in correcting vitamin D deficiency
  • Session V. Pleiotropic actions of vitamin D (Part 2)
      • Vitamin D and brain
      • Vitamin D in overweight and obesity - trivial or significant problem?
      • Assessment of vitamin D deficiency in patients with metabolic syndrome in chronic stress conditions
      • Mitochondria as a target for vitamin D
      • Vitamin D status of patients with diabetic chronic kidney disease and prevention of its progression
      • Session VI. Pleiotropic actions of vitamin D (incl. Young Investigators Session)
      • Extending the vitamin D response index concept based on cohorts from Saudi Arabia
      • Could vitamin D be a Disease-Modifying Antirheumatic Drug (DMARD)?
      • Vitamin D and markers of subclinical inflammation in patients with chronic coronary syndrome
      • In vivo changes of the epigenome of human immune cells after vitamin D challenge
      • Vitamin D status in children and adolescents - data from The Children’s Memorial Health Institute in Warsaw

Introductory lecture: Vitamin D – for health of the individual, does it also influence the public health?

Prof. Andrzej M. Fal (Dept of Allergy, Lung Diseases and Internal Medicine, Central Clinical Hospital, Ministry of Interior, Warsaw, Poland)

item.title: Mortality reduced if Vitamin D levels raised to 30 ng ( Middle East this time) - Grant
item.description:
• Reducing incidence and mortality rates in the UAE and related countries by raising serum 25(OH)D above 30 ng/mL

Reducing incidence and mortality rates in the UAE and related countries by raising serum 25(OH)D above 30 ng/mL

Presented at Vitamin D Conference – 9th Abu Dhabi – Oct 2022

Note by VitaminDWiki: #7 for Saudi Arabia needs Magnesium (none in de-salinated water)

Download the entire PDF from VitaminDWiki

item.title: High-dose vitamin D improves health (presentation)
item.description:
High-dose Vitamin D Supplementation Improves Health (Presented in Rome, August 30, 2021)

IV International Vitamin D Mediterranean Congress Grand hotel Flora, Rome

Dr. Grant

Some of the titles

  • In June some Europeans get more solar UVB than others. In December no European gets enough UVB to make vitamin D.

  • Solar UVB as a Source of Vitamin D

  • Breast Cancer Mortality Rates, 1995-77 [Garland, 1992]

  • VITAL Vitamin D RCT, Harvard [Manson, NEJM, 2019]

item.title: Controversies and consensus in Vitamin D – 3rd Conference
item.description:
Controversies in Vitamin D: A Statement From the Third International Conference

F1

T1

T2

F3 _

The many topics not discussed include

  1. % activation of vitamin D in the cells rather than in the liver & kidneys

  2. When are loading doses better than daily

  3. The many months to plateau the response to a new supplementation level

  4. Efficacy of other forms for Vitamin D, such as nanoemulsion

    • Including gut-friendly forms of vitamin D

  5. Higher Vitamin D thresholds for some diseases

Vitamin D and the Immune System – chapter Aug 2019

Successful high dose vitamin D (Coimbra Protocol) should be evaluated – June 2019

item.title: Vitamin D Workshop in Australia - canceled due to COVID
item.description:
[https://vitamindworkshop.org/australia-2020

PLANNING FOR NEXT MEETING IS ON HOLD (March 25, 2020)

PLEASE NOTE the Covid-19 pandemic has impacted planning for the 2020 Vitamin D Workshop. Australia has prohibited flights in/out of the country until the end of May and also banned large gatherings for 6 months. It is therefore impossible for the August conference to proceed as planned. The involved societies (VDW, ANZBMS and MEPSA) are conferring with the meeting planner ASN and the Gold Coast Convention Center to explore options for postponement, although cancellation is also a possibility.

item.title: Vitamin D has treated Multiple Sclerosis and autoimmune diseases for 16 years – Coimbra
item.description:
Presentation in English at Vitamin D Symposium in Germany April 2018

YouTube Video

    Introduction is in German. Presentation is in English, and can be translated to many other languages

Notes on presentation (not in the same order as presentation)

Protocol was developed over 16 years (since 2002)

Dr. Coimbra has recently applied his protocol to

  • Autism

  • Pregnancy

10,000 IU during pregnancy

| | | | | — | — | — | | | 10,000 IU | normally | | Raise head | 22 days | 90 days | | Start to speak | 2.5 months | 12 months | | Count to 20 | 18 months | 24 months | | Learn foreign language | 36 months | ?? |

item.title: Highlights of 20th Vitamin D Workshop
item.description:
Download the PDF from VitaminDWiki

Personal note on Vitamin D Workshop by Henry Lahore, founder of VitaminDWiki

I have attended 3 of the annual workshops

Workshops are highly technical, but appears to be the best place to meet Vitamin D advocates

I have asked permission to officially record video/photos of the workshops, but have been denied

They wish to make money by charging for the publications

item.description:
There were simultaneous translations between Polish and English.

The following is a translation from Polish by Google

For the third time, it is our pleasure to invite you to participate in the scientific conference “Vitamin D - minimum, maximum, optimum” under the auspices of the European Vitamin D Association (EVIDAS). On 22-23 September 2017 at the Conference Center of the Central Clinical Hospital MSWiA in Warsaw will be held a very interesting scientific meeting with excellent experts from Poland, Europe and the World.

item.title: Vitamin D Workshop notes – Baggerly
item.description:
Notes from the Vitamin D Workshop, Delft, the Netherlands

Carole Baggerly http://www.grassrootshealth.net/

Carole just finished a week-long visit with other international scientists at the Vitamin D Workshop, an annual meeting that focuses on the biology and health implications of Vitamin D. Here are some of her thoughts from the week.

Who attended the Vitamin D Workshop?

Most attendees were from Western Europe and were a very cautious group by and large. Many of the scientists were focused on biochemical research rather than public health action .

item.description:

11:10-11:35 Skin synthesis of vitamin D - pros and cons, Prof. Jacek Lukaszkiewicz (Poland)

item.title: Vitamin D Meeting in Washington DC
item.description:
Vitamin D: Moving Toward Evidence-based Decision Making in Primary Care

Dec 2, 3 2014

Summary notes by VitaminDWiki

  • There may be a problem for vitamin D levels > 50 ng

  • People need a lot more vitamin D than they are getting

  • Controversey as to how much - little conversation about basing dose size on weight

  • Groups who are at high risk of being deficient - they acknowledge only elderly, blacks, excessive clothes so far

item.title: Vitamin D conference in England - April 23-25 2014
item.description:
Update Papers and Abstracts

Conference summary at Vitamin D Council May 2014

  • Dr. Carlos Camargo - risk of peanut or tree-nut allergy in childhood. u-shaped curve,

See VitaminDWiki on u-shaped curves

  • Vieth - vitamin D doses no longer than one month apart

  • Dr. Cameron Grant RCT pregnancy: reduced # of children who were prescribed antibiotics

Multiple Sclerosis has strong associations with Vitamin D – London April 2014 was also presented there

Vitamin D and Human Health: From the Gamete to the Grave

This conference will bring together international experts in the vitamin D field to provide a comprehensive overview of the latest clinical evidence relating to the effects of vitamin D on human health throughout the life course.

item.title: Polish conference recommended vitamin D levels from 30 to 60 ng
item.description:
“Vitamin D – Minimum, maximum, optimum” Warsaw, Poland, Oct. 19-20, 2012

By William B. Grant, Ph.D., Sunlight, Nutrition, and Health Research Center, San Francisco, CA

A vitamin D conference, “Vitamin D – Minimum, maximum, optimum” was held in Warsaw, Poland, Oct. 19-20, 2012, to develop guidelines for vitamin D for Central and Eastern Europe. It was organized by Pawel Plodowski and Elzbieta Karczmarewicz. There were 550 attendees from Poland and other countries.

item.title: Vitamin D Workshop Houston 2012
item.description:
15th Annual: Texas June 20-22, 2012 Website

Recent Vitamin D workshops have generally had

  • 300 to 400 attendees

  • from 20 to 30 countries

  • 40-70 verbal presentations

  • 300-400 poster presentations

Tentative Speakers and Topics as of April 2012

(Just a few of the speakers and topics have hyperlinks added)
Andrew Annalora xray structure of the CYP24A1 vitamin D enzyme
Christine Ambrosone Breast cancer
Paul Anderson What are the implications of local 1a-hydroxylase activity in bone cells
Daniel Bikle PROTECTIVE ROLE OF VITAMIN D SIGNALING IN SKIN CANCER FORMATION
Martin Blomberg-Jensen Vitamin D and male reproduction: evidence for non-genomic effects
Roger Bouillon Modest vitamin D supplementation is the best strategy worldwide
Geert Carmeliet Consequences of selective VDR deletion in osteoblasts
Scott Cramer VDR actions in prostate stem cells
David Feldman ANTICANCER ACTIVITY OF DIETARY VITAMIN D3 IN MOUSE XENOGRAFT MODELS OF BREAST AND PROSTATE CANCER
Christopher Gallagher Role of 1a,25(OH)2D3 in cutaneous infections
David Gardner Cardiac specific VDR KO
Edward Giovannucci Vitamin D doses and 25(OH)D circulating levels, Random Control Trials and good Health;
What we have learned and what remains to be solved
Robert Heaney High 25(OH)D3
Pamela Hershberger Insights into vitamin D – Lung Cancer Relationships
Martin Hewison Immune regulation
Candace Johnson Proliferation and cell cycle progression
Shigeaki Kato TBA
Rebecca Mason The role of the vitamin D receptor and ERp57 in DNA photoprotection by 1,25(OH)2D3
Chantal Mathieu Vitamin D and its analogues as modulators of the immune system: the case of type 1 diabetes
Alison Mondul Consideration of 25(OH)D and DBP levels on the incidence of prostate cancer and bladder cancer; A challenge
Hector Palmer Vitamin D and Wnt/?-catenin pathways crosstalk in epidermal stem cell lineage selection and tumorigenesis
Wesley Pike Intestinal gene expression
Ann Prentice Status of rickets worldwide
Karl Schlingmann 24-Hydroxylase mutations in idiopathic infantile hypercalcemia
Gary Schwartz Serum calcium levels and the risk of prostate cancer
Rene St. Arnaud Biological roles of 1a,24(OH)2D3 and 24,25(OH)2D3 in bone
Naoyuki Takahashi MECHANISM OF INHIBITORY ACTION OF ELDECALCITOL, AN ACTIVE VITAMIN D ANALOG, ON BONE RESORPTION IN VIVO
Carol Wagner Update on pregnancy/lactation intervention trials

None of the workshop sessions will be recorded: decision by workshop committee early June 2012

See comment at the bottom of this page for details

  • International Symposium on Vitamin D Deficiency - Abu Dhabi March 2012 Recordings for you to see and listen to

The German Foundation for Health Information and Prevention (dsgip) was founded in 2009 as a charitable institution. Their name is their program. In the first step, it collects and sifts the latest research in medicine, natural sciences and the adjacent area in the sociological.

item.title: Vitamin D workshop- Rank - UK- 2009
item.description:
